title: Tibia and Fibula Bone Fracture Classification Dataset
description: A comprehensive dataset containing 842 high-resolution PNG images of tibia and fibula fractures, annotated by orthopedic specialists from the University of Gondar. Includes simple, comminuted, and spiral fractures. Designed for training deep learning models in automated fracture detection and classification.
author: University of Gondar Orthopedic Team

title: Human Bone Fracture C17 Dataset
description: Curated collection of 2,100 X-ray images categorized into 17 distinct fracture types (e.g., transverse, oblique, greenstick). Images are anonymized and pre-processed for AI research. Includes metadata on age, gender, and injury mechanism. Ideal for multi-class classification and segmentation tasks.
author: Shatabdi Sarker, Avijit Roy et al.

title: Simple vs. Comminuted Fractures X-ray Dataset
description: High-quality X-ray dataset with 620 images comparing simple (clean break) vs. comminuted (multiple fragments) fractures in long bones. Includes augmented versions (rotation, brightness). Ground truth masks provided for segmentation. Used in clinical decision support systems.
author: Anonymous (Hospital IRB Approved)

title: Multi-Class Bone Fracture X-ray Dataset
description: 1,450 X-ray images labeled as Normal, Simple, or Major fractures. Includes pediatric and geriatric cases. Augmentations applied for robustness. CSV file with patient demographics, fracture location, and AO/OTA classification codes. Perfect for benchmarking AI models.
author: Radiology Research Group

title: HBFMID – Human Bone Fractures Multi-modal Image Dataset
description: Multi-modal dataset with 890 paired X-ray and MRI scans of elbow, wrist, and finger fractures. Includes 3D reconstructions and volumetric data. Annotations include fracture line tracing and bone density measurements. Supports cross-modal learning and fusion research.
author: Medical Imaging Lab, Addis Ababa

title: Pediatric Long Bone Fracture Dataset
description: 500 X-ray images of children aged 2–16 with long bone fractures (humerus, femur, radius). Includes growth plate injuries (Salter-Harris classification). Metadata includes age, weight, and trauma type. Essential for pediatric orthopedics and AI safety studies.
author: Children’s Hospital Research Unit

title: Pathologic Fracture Detection in Osteoporosis
description: 1,200 X-ray and DXA scans from osteoporotic patients with pathologic fractures. Includes BMD T-scores and fracture risk assessment (FRAX). Used to train models for early detection of bone weakness before fracture occurs.
author: Endocrinology & Orthopedics Joint Study

title: Spinal Compression Fracture Dataset (CT)
description: CT scans of 680 vertebral compression fractures in elderly patients. 3D volumetric data with Genant classification. Includes pre- and post-kyphoplasty images. Supports vertebral body segmentation and treatment outcome analysis.
author: Spine Surgery Center

title: Stress Fracture in Athletes (MRI)
description: MRI dataset of 420 stress fractures in runners and military personnel. T2-weighted and STIR sequences highlight bone marrow edema. Includes training load data and recovery timelines. Used in sports medicine and injury prevention research.
author: Sports Medicine Institute

title: Open Fracture Wound Infection Risk Dataset
description: 1,100 cases of open fractures with wound culture results, antibiotic protocols, and healing outcomes. Includes Gustilo-Anderson classification and infection risk scores. Critical for surgical planning and infection control studies.
author: Trauma Surgery Consortium

title: Hip Fracture in Elderly (Dual-Energy X-ray)
description: DXA and X-ray dataset of 900 hip fractures in patients over 65. Includes femoral neck and intertrochanteric fractures. BMD, T-score, and fall risk data included. Used in osteoporosis drug trials and fall prevention algorithms.
author: Geriatric Orthopedics Unit

title: Distal Radius Fracture Fixation Outcomes
description: Post-operative X-ray series of 750 distal radius fractures treated with volar plating. Includes pre-op, immediate post-op, and 1-year follow-up. ROM and DASH scores included. Ideal for surgical technique evaluation and implant design.
author: Hand Surgery Department

title: Ankle Fracture Classification (CT + X-ray)
description: Hybrid dataset with 580 ankle fractures using both X-ray and CT. Lauge-Hansen and Danis-Weber classifications. 3D models included. Supports automated classification and surgical planning systems.
author: Foot & Ankle Research Group

title: Non-Union Fracture Healing Dataset
description: Longitudinal study of 400 non-union fractures with serial X-rays over 12 months. Includes biological (BMP-7) and mechanical interventions. Failure analysis and healing predictors provided. Key for regenerative medicine research.
author: Bone Regeneration Lab

title: AI-Ready Fracture Detection Benchmark
description: Standardized benchmark dataset with 3,000 labeled X-rays covering 8 fracture sites. Train/val/test split provided. YOLO and Mask R-CNN annotations included. Used in international AI challenges and model comparison studies.
author: Global AI in Radiology Initiative
